title: Homemade Cinnamon Applesauce
directions: In a medium pot, toss the apples with the lemon zest, lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
Add the cider (or water) and bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and continue to cook until the apples are very soft, 25 to 30 minutes.
If using, stir in the vanilla extract.

Transfer the applesauce to the mason jars and fasten the lids. Apply a small piece of tape to each jar as pictured, placing one end at the center of the lid and the other end on the side of the jar. Place a label on each jar, over the tape, as shown.
Store the finished applesauce in the refrigerator until ready to serve or gift. The applesauce will keep for up to two and a half weeks in the refrigerator.
ingredients: 4½ pounds apples (such as McIntosh, Fuji, Cortland or Golden Delicious)--peeled, cored and diced
½ cup apple cider or water
